tags: i’m so sorry if this feels rushed or forced
i need to get in the swing of actually finishing fics
body:
Together

So a few weeks ago I asked for some prompts. Long story short, I got a good start on quite a few of them, before getting distracted (by some magazine covers, a trailer, and Schitt’s Creek), and then getting more tired than anticipated by a new role at work. I was finding it a little difficult to write, but I think I’ve managed to finish this one. Here’s to hoping I get a few more of these finished this week! @alexisgalvez53 asked for:

“I’m running away from home - Meet cute with another passenger on the train going to the same destination” Now I’m not entirely sure that this counts as a ‘meet cute’, but it’s what my brain threw out at me. I know this probably isn’t what you had in mind, but I hope you like it? :)

She finds herself looking around, for something, anything, a diversion to pull her focus and calm her racing heart. She glances around for the one thing sure to have her daydreaming, but the dark mop atop the brooding expression is nowhere to be found. She sees him the mornings that she comes, often with a coffee cup, always with headphones, the black wires camouflaged by his dark curls until they reach the ends of his hair, and then disappearing into a jacket pocket. She recalls the last time she saw him, on one especially warm spring day two weeks ago, he had been without a jacket, and the cord had disappeared into the pocket of a pair of rather well fitted jeans. There had been a fading bruise around his eye, and he had tried to hide it with his hair. She often finds herself wondering what he is listening to, whether it’s music or a podcast, an audio book perhaps, or even nothing at all. She often wears headphones with nothing playing, a sign to others that she does not wish to be bothered without actually having to say so. It doesn’t always work, but Daenerys does it regardless.

She cannot see him this particular morning, and Daenerys finds herself missing the distraction he provides. If you asked her to explain it, she would not be able to, but she finds his handsome face a comfort, something as familiar as her journey to the train station. She pulls at the hold-all on her right shoulder, it feels awkward as it knocks against the small handbag slung across her body. She clutches the ticket in her hand tighter, the first time she’s actually purchased one despite coming here at least twice a week for the past year.

She feels half in a daze, is she really doing this? Can she really do this? Can she really leave Viserys to his destructive self? She tries to swallow the knot in her throat, the guilt settling in her stomach. She reminds herself of all the broken promises of change, the shattered apologies that grew all the more hollow. No, she has to do this; needs to do this, it is the only way.

It hadn’t always been like this. He had been loving and caring, to a point, and she did have some good memories of the two of them after mother had… But now… all that was left was self loathing wrapped in a cruel shell, and Daenerys could no longer take being his verbal punching bag.

She sees the train approach, and as everyone on the platform shuffles forward, she takes a moment for a deep breath and joins them. She can do this, and she will. It is after rush hour, so it is not as busy as it might have been, but Daenerys still struggles to spot a seat. She wanders up the aisle before she spots four empty seats at a table in the middle of the carriage, and places her bag in one of the seats before shuffling in and sitting next to the window.

“I’ve never actually seen you get on the train before.” Her eyes snap open at the question, and she sees curly hair sat across from her, his expression gentle, a tentative smile forming on his lips. She had not heard him shuffle into the seat opposite, had purposely not worn her headphones.

She opens her mouth to reply, before realising she needs to clear her throat and that she hasn’t actually spoken yet today. “I haven’t actually got on the train before.”

He nods, and there is something that Daenerys finds comforting about his face, a seed of trust sprouting within her, and she’s not sure why she decides to latch onto it.

“Where are you going?”

“I don’t know.” There’s a small quirk to his eyebrow at her response before his eyes glance down and widen slightly, and Dany drops her gaze as she realises what he has seen on her arm. She tugs on her sleeve, but it is too late, he has already seen it. The fading yellow around her wrist only visible in certain light, but it was still there, the pallor of her skin different. “I’m running away actually.” She’s not sure what has possessed her to tell him, this stranger, about where she is going with a clear overnight bag, but Daenerys finds a slither of comfort warming her spine as she does so.

“Yeah?” She only nods her head in reply, before ducking her head to avoid his kind eyes.

“Me too.” Her head snaps up, and she sees the earnestness plain on his face. That’s when Daenerys notices it. He has a large duffel bag today, and when she looks back up at him, he’s fiddling with his hair and her eyes widen. It wasn’t just a fading black eye he was trying to conceal.

“You know, it’s not the first time I’ve run away?” She quirks her brow at his admission, and he shrugs. “It’s lonely. I find it lonely here, but, people are still there, you know?” And Daenerys does, she does. Despite the loneliness, she still finds a comfort in knowing Vis is still there, and she hates it. Hates it because it’s why she stayed so long, why she let the voice in her head chant about how having him was better than having no family at all.

A weighted quiet settles over them, before he breaks it. “Want to run away together?” She should say no, knows that she should say no. But when she looks up and into his eyes, she finds herself nodding.

He allows a small smile, an understanding silence overcoming them both. A long moment passes, and then he reaches across the table and holds out his hand. Daenerys feels her body stiffen for a moment, before she relaxes. She hesitates for a second before she reaches her own hand out, and closes it around his. He squeezes softly, and Dany finds a comforting warmth at the gesture, spreading from their joined hands to the rest of her body. She can feel pressure pricking at her eyes, and she closes them.

“I’m Jon, by the way.” She blinks, and they both ignore the tear that escapes.

“Nice to meet you Jon. I’m Daenerys.”

“I don’t know.” There’s a small quirk to his eyebrow at her response before his eyes glance down and widen slightly, and Dany drops her gaze as she realises what he has seen on her arm. The fading yellow around her wrist only visible in certain light, but it was still there, the pallor of her skin different. “I’m running away actually.” She’s not sure what has possessed her to tell him, this stranger, about where she is going with a clear overnight bag, but Daenerys finds a slither of comfort warming her spine as she does so.

“Yeah?” She only nods her head in reply, before ducking her head to avoid his kind eyes.

“Me too.” Her head snaps up, and she sees the earnestness plain on his face. That’s when Daenerys notices it. He has a large duffel bag today, and when she looks back up at him, he’s fiddling with his hair and her eyes widen. It wasn’t just a fading black eye he was trying to conceal.

“You know, it’s not the first time I’ve run away?” She quirks her brow at his admission, and he shrugs. “It’s lonely. I find it lonely here, but, people are still there, you know?” And Daenerys does, she does. Despite the loneliness, she still finds a comfort in knowing Vis is still there, and she hates it. Hates it because it’s why she stayed so long, why she let the voice in her head chant about how having him was better than having no family at all.

A weighted quiet settles over them, before he breaks it. “Want to run away together?” She should say no, knows that she should say no. But when she looks up and into his eyes, she finds herself nodding.

He allows a small smile, an understanding silence overcoming them both. A long moment passes, and then he reaches across the table and holds out his hand. Daenerys feels her body stiffen for a moment, before she relaxes. She hesitates for a second before she reaches her own hand out, and closes it around his. He squeezes softly, and Dany finds a comforting warmth at the gesture, spreading from their joined hands to the rest of her body. She can feel pressure pricking at her eyes, and she closes them.

“I’m Jon, by the way.” She blinks, and they both ignore the tear that escapes.

“Nice to meet you Jon. I’m Daenerys.”

blog.title: we are not men.
blog.description: Ella. 18. GoT sideblog. Primary is @followinglilies. Tracking #tuserel.

tags: watch me delete this in a hot minute
im sorry its so overly sweet
title: In Bloom
body:
Hey! So this is my first time writing Daensa or anything in the GoT fandom so please be gentle with me? Anyway, it’s just some random fluff about Dany and Sansa after the war is over and everyone is happy. Bc I know s8 is going to crush me soon and I like to dream.

Daenerys found Sansa in the gardens. She didn’t have to do much looking. More often than not Sansa spent any downtime she had surrounded by the extensive greenery of the palace gardens. It was one of the few places the girl seemed to be able to find solace in a city that had taken so much from her.

It was a beautiful place, especially on a beautiful day. The flowers were in bloom and the leaves on the trees were a bright shade of green. Sunlight dripped lazily above and coated the whole garden in a sense of warmth. Dany saw Sansa before the girl noticed her approaching. She was sitting on the grass, her skirt spread out around her, her eyes were closed and her face was placid. Her red hair was stunning, the backdrop of the azure sky made it look like a beautiful sunset over the water.

“Sansa,” Dany spoke softly, afraid to ruin the serenity of the moment.

“Dany, hello,” Sansa said with a soft smile.

Dany, it was still strange sometimes to hear the name coming from someone who wasn’t her brother. But she liked the way it sounded when Sansa said it. It was soft and caring, and sometimes in the nights, it was raw and passionate.

“Enjoying the nice weather?” Dany asked, taking a seat on the grass.

“Yes, quite so.”

The spring was refreshing after the cold of the winter. The breeze carried around the scent of petals and the sound of carefree laughter.

“I thought I’d check on our little one,” Sansa said.

The girl gestured to the ground next to them where a little tree was sprouting up.

“It’s coming along nicely.”

Daenerys remembered planting the tree. It was after the war had ended. So much had been lost, completely and utterly destroyed. Realistically, she knew a tree couldn’t change of that. But it helped both the girls feel better, even if it was silly. It was nice to have something growing.

“Are you tired?” Dany looked over at Sansa who had closed her eyes again.

“No, I’m alright,” Sansa said.

Dany knew she was lying. Sansa hadn’t gotten a single good night’s sleep since they arrived. Honestly, neither had Dany. Sometimes she thought it would be years until anyone in the kingdom was able to sleep soundly without the constant chase of nightmares.

“Lay your head on me, you can sleep now.”

“I can’t. I have work to do,” she seemed to suddenly remember the overwhelming number of tasks ahead of them as she stirred out of her calm.

“Sansa, you have done more work than anyone in all of the Seven Kingdoms,” Dany took her hand gently, “right now, you need to rest.”

Sansa seemed to consider protesting but ultimately gave in after a stern look. She lay her head down on Dany’s lap and closed her eyes.

Dany ran her fingers through Sansa’s auburn locks. Her hair was smooth and soft and possibly Dany’s favorite thing in the world, well aside from maybe her eyes, or her smile. After a few minutes, Dany reached out to a plant next to her and carefully plucked a few blooms by the stems. She nimbly worked them into Sansa’s hair, carefully braiding strands together with the flowers.

“What are you doing?” Sansa stirred in her lap.

“Hush, I’m doing your hair.”

Sansa let out a small scoff but remained still on Dany. Her porcelain skin shone in the sunlight and her long lashes fluttered slightly as she drifted in and out of sleep.

Dany looked away from Sansa for a moment, turning to the tiny beginnings of a tree growing beside her. The branches were still green and thin. It would be years before the tree had even so much as a blossom. But Dany didn’t mind, they had time. And when it finally bore fruit the two of them would eat lemon cakes from it and sit in its shade.

“Sansa,” Dany spoke softly, afraid to ruin the serenity of the moment.

“Dany, hello,” Sansa said with a soft smile.

Dany, it was still strange sometimes to hear the name coming from someone who wasn’t her brother. But she liked the way it sounded when Sansa said it. It was soft and caring, and sometimes in the nights, it was raw and passionate.

“Enjoying the nice weather?” Dany asked, taking a seat on the grass.

“Yes, quite so.”

The spring was refreshing after the cold of the winter. The breeze carried around the scent of petals and the sound of carefree laughter.

“I thought I’d check on our little one,” Sansa said.

The girl gestured to the ground next to them where a little tree was sprouting up.

“It’s coming along nicely.”

Daenerys remembered planting the tree. It was after the war had ended. So much had been lost, completely and utterly destroyed. Realistically, she knew a tree couldn’t change of that. But it helped both the girls feel better, even if it was silly. It was nice to have something growing.

“Are you tired?” Dany looked over at Sansa who had closed her eyes again.

“No, I’m alright,” Sansa said.

Dany knew she was lying. Sansa hadn’t gotten a single good night’s sleep since they arrived. Honestly, neither had Dany. Sometimes she thought it would be years until anyone in the kingdom was able to sleep soundly without the constant chase of nightmares.

“Lay your head on me, you can sleep now.”

“I can’t. I have work to do,” she seemed to suddenly remember the overwhelming number of tasks ahead of them as she stirred out of her calm.

“Sansa, you have done more work than anyone in all of the Seven Kingdoms,” Dany took her hand gently, “right now, you need to rest.”

Sansa seemed to consider protesting but ultimately gave in after a stern look. She lay her head down on Dany’s lap and closed her eyes.

Dany ran her fingers through Sansa’s auburn locks. Her hair was smooth and soft and possibly Dany’s favorite thing in the world, well aside from maybe her eyes, or her smile. After a few minutes, Dany reached out to a plant next to her and carefully plucked a few blooms by the stems. She nimbly worked them into Sansa’s hair, carefully braiding strands together with the flowers.

“What are you doing?” Sansa stirred in her lap.

“Hush, I’m doing your hair.”

Sansa let out a small scoff but remained still on Dany. Her porcelain skin shone in the sunlight and her long lashes fluttered slightly as she drifted in and out of sleep.

Dany looked away from Sansa for a moment, turning to the tiny beginnings of a tree growing beside her. The branches were still green and thin. It would be years before the tree had even so much as a blossom. But Dany didn’t mind, they had time. And when it finally bore fruit the two of them would eat lemon cakes from it and sit in its shade.

trail.content_raw:
Hey! So this is my first time writing Daensa or anything in the GoT fandom so please be gentle with me? Anyway, it’s just some random fluff about Dany and Sansa after the war is over and everyone is happy. Bc I know s8 is going to crush me soon and I like to dream.

Daenerys found Sansa in the gardens. She didn’t have to do much looking. More often than not Sansa spent any downtime she had surrounded by the extensive greenery of the palace gardens. It was one of the few places the girl seemed to be able to find solace in a city that had taken so much from her.

It was a beautiful place, especially on a beautiful day. The flowers were in bloom and the leaves on the trees were a bright shade of green. Sunlight dripped lazily above and coated the whole garden in a sense of warmth. Dany saw Sansa before the girl noticed her approaching. She was sitting on the grass, her skirt spread out around her, her eyes were closed and her face was placid. Her red hair was stunning, the backdrop of the azure sky made it look like a beautiful sunset over the water.

tags: i just can't see a scenario
where jon being a capable dragon rider in under 3 episodes
does not undermine the journey daenerys struggled through to get there
targaryen blood alone does not make you a dragon rider
and daenerys approval should only go so far with rhaegal
not to mention the implication of
yeah it took dany years to do this but watch this man come in and match her skill in weeks
i'm all for badass targaryen royals riding their dragons together
but it should take jon longer to learn and that outside of an immediate warzone
summary: I'd still rather not see Jon riding dragons next season. Because I don’t trust it to be handled well by male writers. We would...
body: I’d still rather not see Jon riding dragons next season. Because I don’t trust it to be handled well by male writers. We would never see Daenerys pick up a sword and stun everyone with amazing sword fighting skills because the writers know that would take away from Jon and his efforts to become as good a swordsman as he is. Jons’ capability with a sword is one of the things that distinguishes his character. But Jon is probably going to be a pretty remarkable dragon rider in a pretty short span of time and the writers expect us to simply be thrilled with it because Jon is just that amazing. And I really think that they aren’t even going to consider the fact that this will take away from Daenerys and the efforts she’s made to be able to control her dragons and be the extraordinary rider that she is. That is one of the things that distinguishes Daenerys as a character. Yet for these writers, the thought of Jon sharing that trait doesn’t provoke the same fear of undermining Daenerys character as it would the other way around. Basically what I’m saying is that they’re probably not going to deliberately undermine Daenerys but this is exactly where male writers fail every time.

Basically what I’m saying is that they’re probably not going to deliberately undermine Daenerys but this is exactly where male writers fail every time.

summary: My life is unrecognisable compared to what it was - 'Game of Thrones' has opened doors that were never there before. But it can...
caption: My life is unrecognisable compared to what it was - ‘Game of Thrones’ has opened doors that were never there before. But it can be dangerous to see it in those terms, I think. It’s best to take it as it comes and work as hard as you can, and hopefully the other things fall into place.

reblog.comment: My life is unrecognisable compared to what it was - ‘Game of Thrones’ has opened doors that were never there before. But it can be dangerous to see it in those terms, I think. It’s best to take it as it comes and work as hard as you can, and hopefully the other things fall into place.

tags: a song of ice and fire
summary: Magic will absolutely cease to be at the end of A Song of Ice and Fire, because in that world magic is weaponized.  From the...
body:
Magic will absolutely cease to be at the end of A Song of Ice and Fire, because in that world magic is weaponized. 

From the dragons, to the White Walkers to fire magic. These things are all used as weapons against “enemies” and they have grave consequences on the well being of others and the world. Dragons burn fields, people and animals, White Walkers bring icy death and fire magic requires the death or mutilation of a person.

They are weapons. The White Walkers were created to be just that and the dragons are used as such even by Daenerys. 

It’s all gonna have to go for balance and peace to return.

It’s a good thing Daenerys is more than her dragons. She’s also thoughtful, empathetic and treats all people equally. Let’s hope GRRM sees that in his character, or else I will riot.

reblog.comment:
Magic will absolutely cease to be at the end of A Song of Ice and Fire, because in that world magic is weaponized. 

From the dragons, to the White Walkers to fire magic. These things are all used as weapons against “enemies” and they have grave consequences on the well being of others and the world. Dragons burn fields, people and animals, White Walkers bring icy death and fire magic requires the death or mutilation of a person.

They are weapons. The White Walkers were created to be just that and the dragons are used as such even by Daenerys. 

It’s all gonna have to go for balance and peace to return.

It’s a good thing Daenerys is more than her dragons. She’s also thoughtful, empathetic and treats all people equally. Let’s hope GRRM sees that in his character, or else I will riot.

summary: Do you think that there is any significance in the third child of every family? Like Jon is Aegons third child, Dany is Aerys...
question: Do you think that there is any significance in the third child of every family? Like Jon is Aegons third child, Dany is Aerys third child, Arya is Ned’s third child, and Tyrion is Tywins third child. There seems to be so much importance on the characters who were the third kid. Maybe not Arya as much since she’s the only one whose mother didn’t die in childbirth with her but she’s still so important to the story line that it makes me wonder.
answer:
Oh, definitely. The third child is one that does not inherit the title, nor is ever the heir at any point (until the firstborn has a child of their own). Like Benjen Stark or Loras Tyrell, the third child has to seek their own glory by their own merits, otherwise they fall into the shadows of their elder siblings. In short, the third child isn’t remarkable or particularly remembered unless they take the initiative to make something of themselves.

Which is exactly what Jon, Dany, Arya and Tyrion are all about. Jon is a special case, given he never knew his siblings, but it very much applies to him re: Robb and even hypothetically with Aegon who would have been the Crown Prince - not Jon himself.

It reinforces the idea of them being outcasts or destined to never surpass their siblings - but in fact, they’ve all defied expectations.

Regarding Arya’s mother not dying in childbirth - true, that’s a marked difference from the rest. But every parallel doesn’t need to be exactly alike. In the same way that Tyrion doesn’t have a beast of his own, or Bran isn’t a third child, or Dany doesn’t warg the way Jon, Arya or Bran do, it’s about what such a parallel offers to the characters themselves.

Arya’s mother did not die in childbirth, but she still grew up feeling insecure about her mother’s affections. She still ends up motherless, a lost child, desperately wishing for her family. Not unlike the rest, really.

Regardless of the specifics of their situation, I think it ultimately comes down to the fact , Jon, Arya, Dany, Tyrion - and Bran - started from a position in the shadows and are emerging quickly to the top. The unexpected heroes, if you will.
